item.title: Request for Street Cleaning Due to Accumulated Rubbish, 8th February
item.description:
I would like to report an ongoing issue with rubbish accumulation on our street and kindly request assistance with cleaning. Over the past days, a noticeable amount of litter has built up along the pavement and roadside, including plastic waste and rubbish bags. This not only creates an unpleasant appearance but also poses hygiene concerns and may attract animals. I have attached photos to illustrate the current situation. I would appreciate it if the area could be cleaned at your earliest convenience. Thank you very much for your attention and support. Kind regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Milton Road, Lessness Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Rubbish in Redcross way outside Cromwell flats, 8th February
item.description:
The communal bins designated for residents in Cromwell flats Redcross way are being heavily used by members of the public, particularly during busy weekend trading periods. Considerable amounts of rubbish are being left both inside and around the bins, resulting in overflowing waste, litter across the pavement, and what is now becoming a clear public health concern. This location experiences exceptionally high footfall due to the market, and the current bin provision appears wholly inadequate for the volume of waste generated. Residents should not be expected to manage commercial or visitor refuse, nor to live alongside the hygiene risks this situation creates. I would be grateful if the council could urgently: • Arrange an immediate clean-up of the area• Review bin capacity and collection frequency• Consider dedicated waste provision for market visitors and nearby businesses• Explore measures to prevent misuse of residential bins

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Redcross Way, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drains causing huge puddles by Finchley Road Underground Station, 8th February
item.description:

item.title: Please inspect this tree and check if ivy can be removed?, 7th February
